content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player, I would consider the long-term payoff and strategy in this repeated game. If my goal is to maximize my earnings over 75 rounds, I would choose a mixed strategy instead of consistently picking one option (R or B).

One possible mixed strategy could be to pick R about 60% of the time and pick B about 40% of the time. This way, when I pick R and my opponent picks B, I'll still earn something (20$ in this case), which is better than earning nothing if I consistently pick R.

However, it's important to remember that the opponent is anonymous, so I have no information about their strategy. It could be that they are also using a mixed strategy, or they might be trying to exploit my choice by consistently picking the other option. This uncertainty makes the optimal strategy difficult to determine precisely.

In practice, I would likely choose R more frequently due to its higher potential payoff when the opponent picks B (45$ vs 40$). But overall, I would lean towards a mixed strategy to avoid being exploited and maximize my average earnings over the long run. {R} (with a slight bias towards R, but not always picking R).
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In the next round, I would continue with my mixed strategy and pick R again. My reasoning is that by consistently picking R, I have a higher chance of earning the maximum possible payoff (45$) when my opponent decides to pick B. However, since my opponent is anonymous and could also be using a mixed strategy, there's still some uncertainty about their choice in the next round.

So, in the next round, I would choose R again. {R}
